newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul exchange names firms for possible delisting.
newsitem.headline: Seoul exchange names firms for possible delisting.

text.p: The Korea Stock Exchange on Tuesday named eight firms as "possible candidates" for delisting from the exchange and called on investors to exercise caution.
The eight firms are Woo Sung Food Co, Dainong Corp, Doosan Machinery Co, Aluminium of Korea Co, Tongkook General Electronics Co, Han Joo Electronics Co, Chung Won Corp and Daeil Chemical Co.
The first six of them saw accumulated losses outpacing paid-in capital, while the other two were named because their auditors abstained from giving an opinion on annual reports.
An exchange official said the companies would become targets of screening for delisting unless their business conditions improve this year.
